Posts.Content: Hi, Thank you for responding to my message. May I ask you a couple of questions? I am to have surgery on Feb. 1. I am nervous, but anxious to get it over with. How long ago did you have this done? How long was your healing time? Anything you can recommend to help with the healing or the day to day tasks while healing i.e. sleeping, bathing, bras/clothing ? Thank You  for supporting all of "us" out here. I look forward to hearing from you, Toni
Posts.Title: diep surgery

Posts.Content: I live in Wisconsin, I had breast cancer 12 years ago. I had a lumpectomy, chemo ,and radiation. My lastest mamo indecates that I need a massectomy (I choose both breast to be removed with reconstruction) I am going to go with "DIEP" surgery. There are a couple of doctors in Milwaukee that do this procedure, a Dr. Kinney and a Dr. Sterkin, to name two. Has anyone had this surgery with either of these doctors or any other doctors in the Milwaukee area? How was Insurance handle? I need to schedule my surgery soon. Please, if you could share your experence with me I would be so grateful.Thank you in advance Toni
Posts.Title: diep surgery

Posts.Content: Hi Carol , I am so happy to have read your entry.I too have met Dr. Kinney and was very impressed. He seems to be a very kind man. Other than that and up til now, I haven't heard anything about his work. He put both my husband and I at ease right away when we met. I did not get a chance to meet his nurse we've talked a couple of times on the phone. I will be soooooooo glad to have this over with. My surgery is on Feb.1. I too, am very nerves. I tell you what... I'll pray for you and you pray for me. How's that? Quick healing my new friend, Toni
Posts.Title: diep surgery

Posts.Content: On 1/2/2007 Loracgrg wrote: Hi, I also live in Wisconsin in the Milwaukee area and am having bilateral Diep reconstruction on Jan 22nd with Dr. Kinney.  I have heard amazing things about him and have talked to nurses, doctors and patients who have worked with him and I have heard he is a perfectionist and is extremely compassionate.  I met with him about a month ago and was impressed with both him and his nurse.  While I am nervous about the surgery I am confident that I've chosen the right doc.  Let me know what you decide and good luck! Carol Hi Carol,  I don't know if you received my last message or not, I'm still trying to find my way around this site.  I too am having Dr. Kinney do my surgery on Feb.1 and I too am nervous. However, I am very much looking forward to having this over with. I alway say," I wish it was a month from now and 3 weeks into my recovery." It sure is nice to hear  the good things that you heard about Dr. Kinney and his nurse. Fell free to write....we can compare note! I'll keep you in my prayers Toni
Posts.Title: diep surgery
